info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued September 04 at 5:13PM CDT until September 04 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM CDT FOR EASTERN SOMERVELL...SOUTHWESTERN JOHNSON...NORTHERN BOSQUE AND NORTHWESTERN HILL COUNTIES... At 513 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Cleburne State Park, or 16 miles southwest of Cleburne, moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Glen Rose, Blum, Cleburne State Park, Rio Vista and Walnut Springs. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Heavy rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
